The research project "open e-learning content observatory services" (2006/07), short OLCOS, is the first project that was co-funded by the European Commission that pottered at open educational resources.

Thereby an inventory of OER activities, multilingual tutorials and a 'roadmap' concerning the future of OER were developed.

In the context of the project the first OER conference in German-speaking areas was held in Salzburg, Austria (EduMedia conference 16/17th April 2007).

The Grimme Institute is part of an inner circle of prestigious research and service institutions in Europe that adresses mediaculture in depth. The Grimme Institute considers itself as a forum for communicational political debates in Germany and contributes to media theory and practice. 
The Grimme Institutes functions are obersavtion, analysis and assessment of media offerings and media development (from TV and radio up to multi media). Furthermore the Institute encourages competence and knowledge transfer between social parties.
